title: Getting Started with ultragsea
text: ultragsea novel, ultrafast memory optimized gene set enrichment scoring algorithm unlike fGSEA. ultragsea demonstrates highly correlated gene set scores p-values typically 100 times faster fGSEA.

title: Getting Started with ultragsea
text: vignette, package includes small subset pmbc3k single-cell dataset just 50 cells. Please install Seurat SeuratData packages want run vignette full dataset.
code: library("ultragsea") library("msigdbr") gs <- msigdbr::msigdbr(collection = "H") gmt <- tapply(gs$gene_symbol,gs$gs_name,list) length(gmt) #> [1] 50

title: Getting Started with ultragsea
code: G <- gmt2mat(gmt) fc <- rnorm(nrow(G)) names(fc) <- rownames(G) res <- ultragsea(fc, G, format='as.gsea', method='ztest') head(res) #>                               pathway      pval      padj log2err    ES #>                                <char>     <num>     <num>   <num> <num> #> 1:           HALLMARK_APICAL_JUNCTION 0.8340206 0.9703000      NA    NA #> 2:           HALLMARK_HEME_METABOLISM 0.8732700 0.9703000      NA    NA #> 3:     HALLMARK_INFLAMMATORY_RESPONSE 0.7109902 0.9703000      NA    NA #> 4:         HALLMARK_KRAS_SIGNALING_UP 0.9758927 0.9758927      NA    NA #> 5: HALLMARK_OXIDATIVE_PHOSPHORYLATION 0.8634175 0.9703000      NA    NA #> 6:              HALLMARK_ADIPOGENESIS 0.2248032 0.7025100      NA    NA #>            NES  size                             leadingEdge #>          <num> <int>                                  <list> #> 1:  0.20954783   200 CRAT,HRAS,INSIG1,PIK3R3,ACTN2,ADAM9,... #> 2:  0.15950628   200    CA2,BNIP3L,CDC27,H1-0,BCAM,BLVRA,... #> 3:  0.37052654   200    IL4R,CCL2,HBEGF,INHBA,ITGB3,EREG,... #> 4: -0.03021859   200        BMP2,CCND2,LIF,CFB,CSF2,PLAT,... #> 5: -0.17202545   200     ACAA1,DLD,SDHC,ECHS1,GPI,GRPEL1,... #> 6:  1.21385477   200  ALDOA,ECH1,GPX4,CRAT,DHCR7,GADD45A,...

title: Comparing ultragsea with fGSEA
text: ultragsea novel, ultrafast memory optimized gene set enrichment scoring algorithm much like fGSEA. ultragsea typically 10-100x faster fGSEA demonstrates highly correlated enrichment scores highly similar p-values.

title: Comparing ultragsea with fGSEA
code: library("ultragsea") gs <- msigdbr::msigdbr(collection = "H") gmt <- tapply(gs$gene_symbol,gs$gs_name,list) gmt <- rep(gmt,1000)  ## augment names(gmt) <- make.unique(names(gmt)) length(gmt) G <- gmt2mat(gmt) fc <- rnorm(nrow(G)) names(fc) <- rownames(G) top.up <- tail(names(sort(fc)),100) top.dn <- head(names(sort(fc)),100)  res <- list() tt <- peakRAM::peakRAM(   res$fgsea <- fgsea::fgsea(gmt, fc, eps=0),   res$fisher <- gset.fisher2(top.up, top.dn, gmt, fdr=1),   res$camera <- limma::cameraPR(fc, gmt, use.ranks=FALSE),   res$ultragsea.z <- ultragsea(fc, G, method='ztest'),   res$ultragsea.t <- ultragsea(fc, G, method='ttest'),   res$ultragsea.c <- ultragsea(fc, G, method='cor'),   res$cor <- gset.cor(fc, G, compute.p=TRUE, use.rank=FALSE) ) tt[,1] <- names(res) kableExtra::kable(tt)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ivo Kwee. Author. Antonino Zito. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kwee (2025). ultragsea: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment analysis. R package version 0.99.12, https://github.com/bigomics/ultragsea.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ultragsea: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment analysis},   author = {Ivo Kwee},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.99.12},   url = {https://github.com/bigomics/ultragsea}, }

what: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment analysis
title: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment analysis
text: (Warning: work progress! use production purposes) ultragsea ultrafast method compute gene set enrichment preranked list genes like GSEA fGSEA. Although ultragsea uses different statistical test (namely z-test correlation), scores highly correlated p-values highly similar GSEA’s weighted Kolmogorov-Smirnov test. ultragsea computes scores using fast sparse computation parametric p-values typically 10-100x faster fGSEA.

title: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment analysis
text: Ultra-fast preranked gene set enrichment scoring Works regular matrices, sparse matrices, Bioconductor data structures Automatically detects handles Bioconductor objects (SummarizedExperiment, SingleCellExperiment, BiocSet) Built-differential enrichment testing

title: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment analysis
text: ultragsea fast. Ludicrously fast. Please fasten seatbelts usage.

title: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment analysis
text: can install ultragsea GitHub:
code: remotes::install_github("bigomics/ultragsea")

title: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment analysis
text: detailed usage examples tutorials, please see vignettes: Getting Started ultragsea Comparing ultragsea fGSEA ultragsea main gene set scoring algorithm OmicsPlayground, Bioinformatics platform BigOmics Analytics. OmicsPlayground, can perform ultragsea without coding needs.

title: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment analysis
text: {r} library("ultragsea") gs <- msigdbr::msigdbr(collection = "H") gmt <- tapply(gs$gene_symbol,gs$gs_name,list) G <- gmt2mat(gmt) fc <- rnorm(nrow(G)) names(fc) <- rownames(G) res <- ultragsea(fc, G, format='.gsea', method='ztest') head(res)

title: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment analysis
text: technical details please refer papers. Please cite us use ultragsea part research. ultragsea: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment scoring. Akhmedov M., et al., Omics Playground: comprehensive self-service platform visualization, analytics exploration Big Omics Data, NAR Genomics Bioinformatics, 2020, lqz019.

title: Ultrafast preranked gene set enrichment analysis
text: support feel free reach Bioinformatics Data Science Team BigOmics Analytics: help@bigomics.ch like ultragsea, please recommend us friends, buy us coffee brag ultragsea social media.

code: cor_sparse_matrix(G, mat)

text: G Sparse matrix containing gene sets mat Matrix values

title: Calculate sparse correlation matrix handling missing values — cor_sparse_matrix
text: Correlation matrix G mat

title: Calculate sparse correlation matrix handling missing values — cor_sparse_matrix
text: mat missing values, calculates correlation directly using corSparse. Otherwise computes column-wise correlations using non-missing values.

title: Compute z-score matrix for gene sets — fc_zmat

code: fc_zmat(fc, G, alpha = 0.5)

text: fc Numeric vector (log)foldchanges, genes names G Numeric matrix gene sets, genes row names alpha Numeric value 0 1 Bayesian shrinkage

title: Compute z-score matrix for gene sets — fc_zmat

what: Fast one sample z-test for matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) and grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets). — fc_ztest
title: Fast one sample z-test for matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) and grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets). — fc_ztest
text: Fast one sample z-test matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets).

title: Fast one sample z-test for matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) and grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets). — fc_ztest
code: fc_ztest(fc, G, zmat = FALSE, alpha = 0.5)

title: Fast one sample z-test for matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) and grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets). — fc_ztest
text: fc Numeric vector (log)foldchanges, genes names G Numeric matrix gene sets, genes row names zmat Logical indicating whether compute z-score matrix alpha Numeric value 0 1 Bayesian shrinkage

title: Fast one sample z-test for matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) and grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets). — fc_ztest
text: List components: z_statistic - Vector z-test statistics p_value - Vector p-values zmat - Z-score matrix (zmat = TRUE)

what: Convert GMT to Binary Matrix — gmt2mat
title: Convert GMT to Binary Matrix — gmt2mat
text: Convert GMT file (Gene Matrix Transposed) binary matrix, rows represent genes columns represent gene sets. binary matrix indicates presence absence genes gene set.

title: Convert GMT to Binary Matrix — gmt2mat
code: gmt2mat(   gmt,   max.genes = -1,   ntop = -1,   sparse = TRUE,   bg = NULL,   use.multicore = TRUE )

title: Convert GMT to Binary Matrix — gmt2mat
text: gmt List representing GMT file: element character vector representing gene set. max.genes Max number genes include binary matrix. Default = -1 include genes. ntop Number top genes consider gene set. Default = -1 include genes. sparse Logical: create sparse matrix. Default TRUE. FALSE creates dense matrix. bg Character vector background gene set. Default NULL consider unique genes. use.multicore Logical: use parallel processing ('parallel' R package). Default TRUE.

title: Convert GMT to Binary Matrix — gmt2mat
text: binary matrix representing presence absence genes gene set. Rows correspond genes, columns correspond gene sets.

title: Convert GMT to Binary Matrix — gmt2mat
code: # Create example GMT data gmt <- list(   "Pathway1" = c("GENE1", "GENE2", "GENE3"),   "Pathway2" = c("GENE2", "GENE4", "GENE5"),   "Pathway3" = c("GENE1", "GENE5", "GENE6") )  # Convert to binary matrix mat <- gmt2mat(gmt) print(mat) #> 6 x 3 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix" #>       Pathway1 Pathway2 Pathway3 #> GENE1        1        .        1 #> GENE2        1        1        . #> GENE5        .        1        1 #> GENE3        1        .        . #> GENE4        .        1        . #> GENE6        .        .        1  # Create dense matrix instead of sparse mat_dense <- gmt2mat(gmt, sparse = FALSE) print(mat_dense) #>       Pathway1 Pathway2 Pathway3 #> GENE1        1        0        1 #> GENE2        1        1        0 #> GENE5        0        1        1 #> GENE3        1        0        0 #> GENE4        0        1        0 #> GENE6        0        0        1

title: Calculate gene set correlation — gset.cor
text: Compute correlation foldchange vector/matrix gene sets

title: Calculate gene set correlation — gset.cor
code: gset.cor(FC, gset, compute.p = FALSE, use.rank = FALSE)

title: Calculate gene set correlation — gset.cor
text: FC Numeric vector matrix (log)foldchanges, genes row names gset Numeric matrix gene sets, genes row/column names compute.p Logical indicating whether compute p-values use.rank Logical indicating whether rank transform FC correlation

title: Calculate gene set correlation — gset.cor
text: Named list components: rho - Matrix correlation coefficients FC gset p.value - Matrix p-values correlation (compute.p = TRUE) q.value - Matrix FDR adjusted p-values (compute.p = TRUE)

title: Calculate gene set correlation — gset.cor
text: function calculates sparse rank correlation FC column gset using qlcMatrix::corSparse(). handles missing values FC computing column-wise correlations. P-values computed statistical distribution

title: Calculate gene set correlation — gset.cor
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(playbase) ranks <- sample(1:10000, 1000, replace = TRUE) names(ranks) <- replicate(1000, paste(sample(LETTERS, 4, replace = TRUE), collapse = "")) genesets <- matrix(rnorm(1000 * 20), ncol = 20) rownames(genesets) <- names(ranks)  gset.rankcor(ranks, genesets, compute.p = TRUE) } # }

what: Perform Fisher's exact test on gene sets — gset.fisher
title: Perform Fisher's exact test on gene sets — gset.fisher
text: function performs Fisher's exact test set genes within given set gene sets. returns data frame containing results test, including p-values, q-values, odds ratios, gene set overlaps.

title: Perform Fisher's exact test on gene sets — gset.fisher
code: gset.fisher(   genes,   genesets,   background = NULL,   fdr = 0.05,   mc = TRUE,   sort.by = "zratio",   nmin = 3,   min.genes = 15,   max.genes = 500,   method = "fast.fisher",   check.background = TRUE,   common.genes = TRUE,   no.pass = NA,   verbose = 1 )

title: Perform Fisher's exact test on gene sets — gset.fisher
text: genes character vector containing names genes. genesets list gene sets, element character vector representing gene set. background character vector containing names genes background set. Defaults NULL, means genes considered. fdr false discovery rate (FDR) threshold multiple testing adjustment. Defaults 0.05. mc logical value indicating whether perform multiple testing adjustment using Monte Carlo simulation. Defaults TRUE. sort.statistic used sort results. Defaults "zratio". nmin minimum number genes required gene set test performed. min.genes minimum number genes gene set considered. Defaults 15. max.genes maximum number genes gene set considered. Defaults 500. method method used computing p-values. Defaults "fast.fisher". check.background logical value indicating whether check presence genes background set. Defaults TRUE. common.genes logical value indicating whether use genes common input gene set background set. Defaults TRUE. verbose numeric value indicating level verbosity. Defaults 1.

title: Perform Fisher's exact test on gene sets — gset.fisher
text: data frame containing results Fisher's exact test. data frame includes columns "p.value" (p-value), "q.value" (adjusted p-value), "odd.ratio" (odds ratio), "overlap" (gene set overlap), optionally "genes" (common genes).

what: Perform Fisher's exact test on gene sets — gset.fisher2
title: Perform Fisher's exact test on gene sets — gset.fisher2
text: function performs Fisher's exact test two sets genes, genes.genes.dn, within given set gene sets (genesets). returns data frame containing results test, including sign fold change (positive negative) relevant statistics p-values, q-values, odds ratios.

title: Perform Fisher's exact test on gene sets — gset.fisher2
code: gset.fisher2(   genes.up,   genes.dn,   genesets,   background = NULL,   fdr = 0.05,   mc = TRUE,   sort.by = "zratio",   nmin = 3,   verbose = 1,   min.genes = 15,   max.genes = 500,   method = "fast.fisher",   check.background = TRUE,   common.genes = TRUE )

title: Perform Fisher's exact test on gene sets — gset.fisher2
text: genes.character vector containing names genes "" set. genes.dn character vector containing names genes "" set. genesets list gene sets, element character vector representing gene set. background character vector containing names genes background set. Defaults NULL, means genes considered. fdr false discovery rate (FDR) threshold multiple testing adjustment. Defaults 0.05. mc logical value indicating whether perform multiple testing adjustment using Monte Carlo simulation. Defaults TRUE. sort.statistic used sort results. Defaults "zratio". nmin minimum number genes required gene set test performed. verbose numeric value indicating level verbosity. Defaults 1. min.genes minimum number genes gene set considered. Defaults 15. max.genes maximum number genes gene set considered. Defaults 500. method method used computing p-values. Defaults "fast.fisher". check.background logical value indicating whether check presence genes background set. Defaults TRUE. common.genes logical value indicating whether use genes common input gene sets background set. Defaults TRUE.

title: Perform Fisher's exact test on gene sets — gset.fisher2
text: data frame containing results Fisher's exact test. data frame includes columns "sign" (fold change sign), "odd.ratio" (odds ratio), "p.value" (p-value), "q.value" (adjusted p-value), others.

what: Convert Binary Matrix to GMT — mat2gmt
title: Convert Binary Matrix to GMT — mat2gmt
text: Convert binary matrix GMT (Gene Matrix Transposed) list. binary matrix indicates presence absence genes gene set. Rows represent genes columns represent gene sets.

title: Convert Binary Matrix to GMT — mat2gmt
code: mat2gmt(mat)

title: Convert Binary Matrix to GMT — mat2gmt
text: mat Matrix non-zero entries representing genes gene set. Rows represent genes columns represent gene sets.

title: Convert Binary Matrix to GMT — mat2gmt
text: list vector representing gene set. list element correspond gene set vector genes

title: Convert Binary Matrix to GMT — mat2gmt
code: # Create example binary matrix mat <- matrix(0, nrow = 6, ncol = 3) rownames(mat) <- paste0("GENE", 1:6) colnames(mat) <- paste0("Pathway", 1:3) mat[1:3, 1] <- 1  # Pathway1: GENE1, GENE2, GENE3 mat[c(2,4,5), 2] <- 1  # Pathway2: GENE2, GENE4, GENE5 mat[c(1,5,6), 3] <- 1  # Pathway3: GENE1, GENE5, GENE6  # Convert to GMT list gmt <- mat2gmt(mat) print(gmt) #> $Pathway1 #> [1] "GENE1" "GENE2" "GENE3" #>  #> $Pathway2 #> [1] "GENE2" "GENE4" "GENE5" #>  #> $Pathway3 #> [1] "GENE1" "GENE5" "GENE6" #>

what: Fast one sample t-test for matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) and grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets). — matrix_onesample_ttest
title: Fast one sample t-test for matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) and grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets). — matrix_onesample_ttest
text: Fast one sample t-test matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets).

title: Fast one sample t-test for matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) and grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets). — matrix_onesample_ttest
code: matrix_onesample_ttest(F, G)

title: Fast one sample t-test for matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) and grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets). — matrix_onesample_ttest
text: F Numeric vector matrix (log)foldchanges G Numeric matrix gene sets, genes row names

title: Fast one sample t-test for matrix object F (e.g. foldchanges) and grouping matrix G (e.g. gene sets). — matrix_onesample_ttest
text: List components: mean - Mean values t - t-test statistics p - p-values t-test

title: Read GMT File — read.gmt
text: Read data GMT file (Gene Matrix Transposed). GMT format commonly used store gene sets gene annotations.

title: Read GMT File — read.gmt
code: read.gmt(gmt.file, dir = NULL, add.source = FALSE, nrows = -1)

title: Read GMT File — read.gmt
text: gmt.file Path GMT file. dir (Optional) directory GMT file located. add.source (optional) Include source information gene sets' names. nrows (optional) Number rows read GMT file.

title: Read GMT File — read.gmt
text: list gene sets: gene set represented character vector gene names.

title: Read GMT File — read.gmt
code: # \donttest{ # Read GMT file (requires file to exist) gmt_file <- system.file("extdata", "hallmarks.gmt", package = "plaid") if (file.exists(gmt_file)) {   gmt <- read.gmt(gmt_file)   print(names(gmt))   print(head(gmt[[1]]))      # Read with source information   gmt_with_source <- read.gmt(gmt_file, add.source = TRUE)   print(head(names(gmt_with_source))) } # }

what: Ultra-fast GSEA using z-score or geneset correlation. Results of these methods highly correlate with GSEA/fGSEA but are much faster. — ultragsea
title: Ultra-fast GSEA using z-score or geneset correlation. Results of these methods highly correlate with GSEA/fGSEA but are much faster. — ultragsea
text: Ultra-fast GSEA using z-score geneset correlation. Results methods highly correlate GSEA/fGSEA much faster.

title: Ultra-fast GSEA using z-score or geneset correlation. Results of these methods highly correlate with GSEA/fGSEA but are much faster. — ultragsea
code: ultragsea(   fc,   G,   alpha = 0.5,   minLE = 1,   method = c("ztest", "ttest", "cor", "rankcor")[1],   format = c("simple", "as.gsea")[1] )

title: Write GMT File — write.gmt
text: Write gene sets GMT file (Gene Matrix Transposed). GMT format commonly used store gene sets gene annotations.

title: Write GMT File — write.gmt
code: write.gmt(gmt, file, source = NA)

title: Write GMT File — write.gmt
text: gmt list gene sets GMT format: gene set represented vector gene names. file file path write GMT file. source character vector specifying source gene set. provided, names gene sets used source.

title: Write GMT File — write.gmt
text: return anything.

title: Write GMT File — write.gmt
code: # Create example GMT data gmt <- list(   "Pathway1" = c("GENE1", "GENE2", "GENE3"),   "Pathway2" = c("GENE2", "GENE4", "GENE5"),   "Pathway3" = c("GENE1", "GENE5", "GENE6") )  # \donttest{ # Write to GMT file (creates file in temp directory) temp_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".gmt") write.gmt(gmt, temp_file)  # Write with custom source information temp_file2 <- tempfile(fileext = ".gmt") write.gmt(gmt, temp_file2, source = c("DB1", "DB2", "DB3"))  # Clean up unlink(c(temp_file, temp_file2)) # }
